game

Class Jail

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Jail

  • public class Jail
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the Jail class and handles all of the interactions of a player with the jail square such as sending to Jail, removing from jail, using a get out of jail free card, handling a jail move such as when you are leaving It has no class variables and is purely an implementation class of methods
    Author:
    Robert Keenan and Ciaran Nolan

    • Method Detail

      • sendToJail

        public static void sendToJail(Player jailedPlayer)
        The method which sends a player to jail in the argument. It prints that the player has been sent to jail. It then uses the player method setInJail to change their jail status and set their location to square number 10(Jail)
        Parameters:
        jailedPlayer - The player object to be jailed

      • removeFromJail

        static void removeFromJail(Player jailedPlayer,
                           boolean rolledDouble,
                           java.io.BufferedReader userInput)
        Removing a player from jail. If they didn't roll a double, they can roll the dice and move to that square. Then we perform CheckSquare
        Parameters:
        jailedPlayer - The player that is jailed and will now be freed from jail
        rolledDouble - Whether or not the player has rolled a double to free them from jail
        userInput - BufferedReader used for simulating user input for much more complex tests in JUnit

      • handleJailFreeCardUsage

        private static void handleJailFreeCardUsage(Player jailedPlayer,
                                            java.io.BufferedReader userInput)
        This handles using a get out of jail free card to leave jail. It will check what pile of cards it came from, either community chest or chance, add it back to back to the bottom of the pile of cards and then remove it from the Arraylist of jail free cards that the jailedPlayer object possesses. It then calls removeFromJail() to remove them from jail
        Parameters:
        jailedPlayer - The player who is jailed who is using the get out of jail free card
        userInput - BufferedReader used for simulating user input for much more complex tests in JUnit

      • handleFinalRollAttempt

        private static void handleFinalRollAttempt(Player jailedPlayer,
                                           java.io.BufferedReader userInput)
        This handles the rolls a player makes when in jail. They can either pay the fine (if they have enough money), use a get out of jail free card if they have one or if they do not have enough for a fine, they will go bankrupt
        Parameters:
        jailedPlayer - The Player object who is jailed
        userInput - BufferedReader used for simulating user input for much more complex tests in JUnit

      • handleJailMove

        static void handleJailMove(Player jailedPlayer)
        This method handles the moves they make while the jailedPlayer object is in jail such as rolling to see can they roll a double ,paying their fine or using a get out of jail free card
        Parameters:
        jailedPlayer - The player who is currently in jail who is asked to either roll a dice, pay a fine or use a get out of jail free card if they have one
